1: Lord, how[c] numerous are my enemies! Many attack me.[d]
2: Many say about me, “God will not deliver him.”[e] (Selah)[f]
3: But you, Lord, are a shield that protects me;[g] you are my glory[h] and the one who restores me.[i]
4: To the Lord I cried out,[j] and he answered me from his holy hill.[k] (Selah)
5: I rested and slept; I awoke,[l] for the Lord protects[m] me.
6: I am not afraid[n] of the multitude of people[o] who attack me from all directions.[p]
7: Rise up,[q] Lord! Deliver me, my God! Yes,[r] you will strike[s] all my enemies on the jaw; you will break the teeth[t] of the wicked.[u]
8: The Lord delivers;[v] you show favor to your people.[w] (Selah)
